goal.title: Responsible Consumption and Production
goal.description: Ensure sustainable consumption and production patterns.

targets.description: Implement the 10-Year Framework of Programmes on Sustainable Consumption and Production, with all countries taking action, developed countries taking the lead.

examples.title: EU Circular Economy Action Plan
examples.description: The European Union adopted a Circular Economy Action Plan to promote recycling, sustainable product design, and reduced waste.

examples.title: Japan’s 3R Initiative
examples.description: Japan promotes the Reduce, Reuse, Recycle (3R) Initiative to cut waste and optimize resource use.

targets.description: By 2030, achieve sustainable management and efficient use of natural resources.

examples.title: Sustainable Forestry in Finland
examples.description: Finland manages forests sustainably, balancing timber production with biodiversity conservation.

examples.title: Water Efficiency in Singapore
examples.description: Singapore’s NEWater program recycles treated wastewater into drinking water, reducing reliance on imports.

targets.description: By 2030, halve per capita global food waste at the retail and consumer levels and reduce food losses along production and supply chains.

examples.title: Too Good To Go App
examples.description: This app connects consumers with restaurants and shops to purchase surplus food at reduced prices.

examples.title: France’s Food Waste Law
examples.description: France banned supermarkets from throwing away unsold food, requiring them to donate it instead.

targets.description: By 2020, achieve environmentally sound management of chemicals and all wastes, and reduce their release to air, water, and soil.

examples.title: Basel Convention
examples.description: An international treaty designed to reduce hazardous waste movements between nations and ensure safe disposal.

examples.title: Sweden’s Chemical Tax
examples.description: Sweden introduced a tax on hazardous chemicals in electronics to encourage safer alternatives.

targets.description: By 2030, substantially reduce waste generation through prevention, reduction, recycling, and reuse.

examples.title: San Francisco Zero Waste Program
examples.description: San Francisco has implemented strict recycling and composting laws to achieve zero waste.

examples.title: Plastic Bag Ban in Kenya
examples.description: Kenya introduced one of the world’s strictest bans on plastic bags, reducing plastic waste significantly.

targets.description: Encourage companies, especially large and transnational companies, to adopt sustainable practices and integrate sustainability information into their reporting cycle.

examples.title: Unilever Sustainable Living Plan
examples.description: Unilever integrates sustainability into its operations, reducing environmental impact and improving livelihoods.

examples.title: Patagonia’s Environmental Reporting
examples.description: Patagonia publishes transparent reports on its environmental footprint and sustainable supply chain practices.

targets.description: Promote public procurement practices that are sustainable, in accordance with national policies and priorities.

examples.title: Green Public Procurement in the EU
examples.description: The European Union promotes green public procurement guidelines to encourage sustainable purchasing by governments.

examples.title: South Korea’s Green Purchasing Law
examples.description: South Korea mandates government agencies to prioritize eco-friendly products in procurement decisions.

targets.description: By 2030, ensure that people everywhere have the relevant information and awareness for sustainable development and lifestyles in harmony with nature.

examples.title: UN SDG Awareness Campaign
examples.description: The United Nations runs global campaigns to raise awareness of sustainable consumption and production.

examples.title: Educational Programs in Costa Rica
examples.description: Costa Rica integrates sustainability education into schools, teaching students about eco-friendly practices.
